blocks.value: Saint Dominic Savio was a student of Saint John Bosco who chose as his motto: 'Death, but not sin!' He became one of the youngest non-martyred saints, dying at only 14 years old.

From an early age, Dominic showed exceptional piety. At his First Communion, he made four resolutions: frequent Confession and Communion, devotion to Mary, making Sundays holy, and befriending Jesus. He was a peacemaker among his classmates.

Dominic fell ill and died peacefully in 1857, asking his father if he was seeing wonderful things. He whispered, 'Oh, what beautiful things I see!' He was canonized in 1954 and is the patron saint of choirboys and juvenile delinquents.
